venue.address_2: Congress Street across from City Hall
venue.name: Faneuil Hall (in front of the Samuel Adams statue)

item.description:
Faneuil Hall Annual Tree Lighting Ceremony

when: 20 Nov 2010 (annual)
where: Faneuil Hall Marketplace
cost: Free
time: Lighting 5.30pm
Seasonal music reverberates around Faneuil Hall Marketplace as bell ringers, the Boston Symphony Orchestra and a capella choirs entertain the crowds at Boston's annual Tree Lighting Ceremony. Be there when the switch is flipped and over 300,000 lights brighten the square.

Join Social Fun members at this spectacular holiday event!

Dress warmly and wear something red so that we can find each other and hold spots near the tree as it gets packed.

Carpooling suggested....
item.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing a red cape and ask members to wear something red as well so that we can find each other in the crowd. I will only wait a few minutes after 3pm as it gets cold if you don't move around.
item.name: Boston Annual Tree Lighting
